image.altText: Pam, partner and furniture

props.synopsis: Amid the increasing demand on outreach services, some communities are banding together to try and bridge the gap for those struggling to make ends meet.

title.children: When Pam had 'no idea' how she was going to feed her two daughters, her community threw her a lifeline. Now she's paying it forward

props.synopsis: A radical sovereign citizen group co-invented by a fugitive mother is using a fake court to justify attempted child abduction, extortion, and intimidation of court officials.

title.children: The fake court harassing families and courts with 'utter weightless legal gobbledygook'

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to the media during a press conference

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns has asked the state Labor Party's general secretary to suspend the CFMEU's construction and general division's affiliation and cease donations or affiliation fees from the union.

title.children: Chris Minns moves to suspend CFMEU from NSW Labor Party

image.altText: A blue and red sign reading "no excuse for abuse" plastered on a glass window.

props.synopsis: The stabbing of a security officer at a Queensland hospital has exposed how vulnerable guards are to attacks involving edged-weapons and there are growing calls for security upgrades.

title.children: Knife attack on Queensland hospital guard prompts fresh calls for stab-proof vests

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The suspect in the killings of Australian couple David James Fisk and Lucita Barquin Cortez and their Filipina companion at at a luxury resort in the Philippines has surrendered.

title.children: Police say suspect in killing of Australian couple in Philippines 'wanted to get back at the hotel for his dismissal'

image.altText: A 3D model of the Trump rally shooting.

props.synopsis: To get a better understanding of the position of the shooter in relation to the US Secret Service snipers, the ABC has recreated the scene of the fatal rally in Pennsylvania.

title.children: This 3D models offers clues into the view Secret Service had of Trump shooting suspect

image.altText: a bus and a bike on the ground

props.synopsis: The boy was riding his bike when he was struck in Buderim on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Boy, 11, killed after being hit by school bus while riding his bike at Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Trump with a bandage over his ear in a suit.

props.synopsis: A bandaged Donald Trump makes his first public appearance since his attempted assassination, and a running mate with a surprising past is announced. These are the big moments from the Republican convention's first day.

title.children: How Trump's bandaged ear stole the show on day one of the Republican convention

image.altText: Jill and Roger Guard smile, wearing formalwear as they pose for a photo in a sunlit garden setting.

props.synopsis: For thousands of Australians, the world changed forever on July 17, 2014. A decade later, those who knew and loved the 38 Australians who lost their lives on MH17 are determined to ensure their memories will never be forgotten.

title.children: A decade after the MH17 tragedy devastated Australian families, tributes burn bright

image.altText: JD Vance stands with arms folded across his chest, chin raised

props.synopsis: When Donald Trump first took office, JD Vance boldly declared he would never support him. So how did this conservative venture capitalist-turned-politician win over the former president to become his pick for Republican vice-president?

title.children: Once a self-declared 'Never Trumper', JD Vance is now aligned on everything from abortion to the war in Ukraine

image.altText: An elderly Asian woman standing next to a larger, middle-aged Caucasian male.

props.synopsis: Lily and her real estate agent are among a growing number of Australians who have been targeted by cyber criminals.

title.children: 'Every minute for me is suffering': Scammers target Australian property sales

image.altText: Queensland players embrace as they celebrate defeating NSW in State of Origin III.

props.synopsis: A lot has been written about the Blues' inability to win Origin deciders in Queensland, but their record in winner-takes-all matches over 42 years is poor regardless of geography.

title.children: As Queensland hopes for another great Origin escape, the Blues are trying to disregard decades of despair

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: The child was taken to hospital by her father in 2019, three years before her death, weighing just 13 kilograms.

title.children: Eizabeth Struhs was 'emaciated, malnourished' in hospital admission three years before her death, clinician tells court

image.altText: POlice officers on a roof look through the sights of their rifles.

props.synopsis: US officials say a threat from Iran prompted the the Secret Service to boost protection around Donald Trump before Saturday's attempted assassination.

title.children: US officials say Secret Service received intelligence about Iranian plot to assassinate Trump

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: A pathway forward on how to respond to allegations the high-profile union was infiltrated by underworld figures could become clearer when the Labor Party's national executive meets.

title.children: Labor sets sights on independent administrator to address CFMEU allegations

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a federal police commanders' uniform smiles.

props.synopsis: One of the key police support figures for families of those killed when MH17 was shot down, Yvonne Crozier, says for some families that terrible day 10 years ago "feels like it was yesterday".

title.children: Yvonne supported families of those who died on flight MH17. She says 10 years on, the grief remains

image.altText: A piece of plane wreckage bearing the Malaysia Airlines livery in a field.

props.synopsis: A decade ago, a Malaysia Airlines plane was shot out of the sky and crashed in eastern Ukraine, killing everyone on board. Here's a brief summary of the MH17 disaster.

title.children: Flight MH17 was shot down in 2014. Here's what happened to the Malaysia Airlines plane

image.altText: Jeanine Kimm in the shearing shed

props.synopsis: There are just 2,000 sheep shearers left keeping a $3.5 billion export industry alive. Rather than sit on idle hands, hardened workers are trying to entice the next generation into the shed.

title.children: 'Shear hard … have a house paid off in ten years': Bid to entice the next generation of sheep shearers

image.altText: Four rugby players, 2 women and 2 men, pose in a dressing room. Two are in blue shirts and two in maroon

props.synopsis: They've labelled a campaign backed by the NSW government, the alcohol industry and the NRL as a "slimy tactic".

title.children: As workers on the domestic violence front line prepare for Origin night, here’s what they think the NRL and government could do to help

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher following US retail sales data supporting the view the Federal Reserve is approaching its easing cycle, reining in inflation while avoiding a recession. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise after Dow notches record closing high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ATO takes 'firmer' action against directors it says owe billions tax and super
US June retail sales stronger than expected

image.altText: A blue Telstra T letter and oval next to a hanging shop sign with the word 'Telstra' on it

props.synopsis: The communications watchdog found Telstra failed to authenticate customer IDs during 168,000 high-risk interactions such as password resets or SIM card swaps.

title.children: Telstra fined $1.5m for leaving customers vulnerable to scams

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair is shouting into a megaphone at a pro-Palestinian student rally

props.synopsis: Young people's view of politics and political expression differs from older generations, and they're showing it by abandoning the two major parties.

title.children: Young diverse voters split with Labor over war in Gaza

image.altText: Karen Harvey smiling with her daughter in the kitchen.

props.synopsis: People with food allergies say the price of their weekly shop has more than doubled, with industry experts suggesting subsidised groceries could relieve the pressure.

title.children: 'It's actually depressing': Coeliac sufferers hit hard by price hikes at the checkout

image.altText: A composite image of the woman and man in seperate images.

props.synopsis: Often referred to as the "second oldest profession", espionage is a tool used by many countries to keep tabs on their adversaries. So what were spies for Russia doing in Australia and how were they able to keep operating in secret?

title.children: I am a former FBI special agent. This is how Russian intelligence operates and why Australia was a target

image.altText: A woman holds a piece of paper and stares blankly while sitting at a dining table.

props.synopsis: After being rescued by emergency helicopter in Tasmania, Kayla Dempsey was shocked to receive the massive bill more than a year later.

title.children: 14 months after rolling her ankle, Kayla was billed $45,000

image.altText: Eminem wears a black hoodie and short beard as he looks at camera.

props.synopsis: Eminem's new album is frustrating, but there are four new Australian albums that more than make up for it.

title.children: Is the new Eminem album any good? Plus, four other Australian albums that definitely are

image.altText: Policemen walk inside a hotel.

props.synopsis: Thai police are investigating the deaths of six foreign nationals whose bodies were found in a room at a luxury hotel in Bangkok.

title.children: Six found dead in luxury Bangkok hotel room after suspected poisoning

image.altText: Secret service agents cover presidential staff as a chaotic crowd forms at the scene of the attempted assassination.

props.synopsis: I worked for former US president Ronald Reagan when an assassin opened fire in 1981. His good nature buoyed the American public and brought unity across the political divide. This is why I believe it will be a challenge for Donald Trump to do the same.

title.children: When Ronald Reagan survived an assassination attempt he found new political purpose. How will Trump respond?

image.altText: A large mob of people wielding sticks and batons attacks each other

props.synopsis: Paramilitary forces are working to keep order across Bangladesh as student and pro-government groups clash over the country's public service hiring policy.

title.children: Six people killed in violent student protests in Bangladesh

image.altText: Jack Black and Kyle Gass of Tenacious D play guitars. Black holds up the devil horns sign with his fingers.

props.synopsis: Jack Black says he no longer feels it is "appropriate" to continue the Tenacious D tour as the internet erupts over a controversial joke at the band's recent Sydney show.

title.children: Tenacious D's remaining Australian concerts cancelled amid Trump joke controversy

image.altText: Sally McManus standing in front of an ACTU banner.

props.synopsis: ACTU secretary Sally McManus denies prior knowledge of alleged criminality within the CFMEU as politicians come under fire over letters sent in 2022.

title.children: Sally McManus issues multiple denials over whether she knew of alleged criminality in CFMEU

image.altText: A West Coast AFL player lies on the ground after being tackled as a Brisbane forward lies on top of him.

props.synopsis: GWS's Toby Bedford has joined Brisbane Lions star Charlie Cameron in failing to overturn a three-game ban at the AFL Tribunal for tackling.

title.children: 'Suspension is a disgrace': Charlie Cameron out for three weeks as rough conduct charge upheld

image.altText: woman at ocean scene

props.synopsis: Scenes of some of South Australia's most violent encounters between First Nations groups and European settlers have been woven into an experience focused on "sharing both sides of the story".

title.children: Rise in truth-telling tourism reckons with 'original story of Australia'

image.altText: An aerial view showing farmland and all of the development around it with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The heartbroken family of Maroochydore's last farmer has put all of a prime parcel of farmland up for sale as they navigate life after Peter Wise's death.

title.children: Family of Maroochydore's last farmer puts prime land up for sale after decades of hold-outs
